column1: Please enter your nickname, defined 28 days ago.
column2: Have you practiced mindful relaxation continuously and usually in the past 4 weeks? ( If NO, you do not meet our sampling criteria -> we still appreciate your effort)
column3: In terms of stress level, on a scale from 1-5, using only integers, how would you rate your stress arising from your work or any events directly related to your work on a working day?
column4: In terms of focus level, on a scale from 1-5, using only integers, how much do you focus on your current work, with mind at present?
column5: When you received newly assigned tasks, how often do you feel fully occupied?
column6: How often do you feel you are competent and capable when handling tasks?
column7: How often do you feel it is difficult to stay focused on what’s happening in the present?
column8: How often do you feel stressed out when you encountered unknown errors?
column9: How often do you not concentrate enough on your work?
column10: How often do you find yourself not working as carefully as you should?
column11: How often do you experience some emotion and not be conscious of it until some time later?
column12: How often do you get so focused on the goaI you want to achieve that Iose touch with what you are doing right now to get there?
column13: Using the same 0-to-10 scale, how would you rate your overall job performance on the days you worked during the past week?
column14: How did you state of mind change over the past 28 days?
column15: When received newly assigned tasks, I will handle it as smoothly as I can.
column16: When formulating commit messages, I can remember exactly what I have modified.
column17: When taking a break, my mind is still always full of technical issues.
column18: How often do you do no work at times when you are supposed to be working?
column19: How do you find communicating  with teammates when collaborating? ( Only answer this if you've been working within a team.)
column20: In your daily work, how did you do things differently over the 28 days mindful relaxation?
